list_definition.mean_english: người, vật, sự kiện kỳ quặc
list_definition.definition: an unusual or abnormal event, person or thing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A storm as bad as that one is a freak of nature

list_definition.definition: a person who is wildly enthusiastic about something

list_ex_of_english: Here, the fantastical sphinx, herself a freak of nature, becomes the emblem of good design, abstract and laden with symbolic meaning.
The disciplines of the control freaks have been applied ruthlessly in government.
Their action was one of those freaks of freedom which occur from time to time and which people enjoy.
They would indeed be administrative freaks; and of course administrators do not like freaks, they like tidy and uniform administrative patterns.
He decided to create a show that featured various oddball characters and freaks of nature.
Climate protection is not a marginal subject for environment freaks, it is one of the greatest challenges of our time.
Even so, there were still icing problems during freak weather conditions soon after completion.
Intellectuals are still seen by party leaders as genetically flawed, and by ordinary people as underpaid freaks, always making trouble for themselves.
